replies.body:
> Granted i was toxic but no where near PERMABAN level 

You can arrive at a perma-ban through escalation. Meaning, all you needed after your last penalty was enough to warrant any sort of penalty (even a chat restriction) to arrive at a perma ban.

You just got off a 14-ban days ago.

The reason Riot doesn't give you both sides of the conversation is for the express purpose of teaching you what YOU did wrong. One of your last messages included you stating that you had muted him, which you should have done the moment he started getting toxic. Instead, you had started snapping back and spouting insults like "Bronzie" and "garbage ass" towards him. 
While I don't believe you've done anything worthy of a permanent ban from this game alone, you've neglected to state your history with punishments. I do wholly believe that you deserve some form of punishment from your toxicity. You may have just been on that step of the punishment ladder. 
The best thing I can tell you now is to submit a ticket to Riot asking about your history with negative activity, and if they could repeal the ban, but the chances of them doing so are very VERY slim. You'd be better off taking a break from League, collecting yourself, and trying to reform should you choose to rejoin the community. Best of luck!

When you had the 2 week ban, it explicitly said that further negative behavior would result in a permanent ban.

Also, this is kinda the goal - Riot issues permanent bans when they want someone to leave League of Legends. They don't keep giving chances and allowing people to make more games miserable for more people.

You are right, they _don't_ care about individual cases, nor should they. You were punished for your actions and only your actions. You showed continued toxic behavior and it got you banned. There is no reason to "defend yourself" as that is often just retaliating _in a toxic manner_ which means the game now has another toxin source in it.

>C9 Snick: oh so you're fine with %%%%s?

Also, anything the boards censor is considered a **Zero tolerance** word, this likely is what triggered _this_ punishment, regardless you do not seem to be on the path of changing your attitude. If you decide to come back just remember, "You are not defending yourself, you are feeding a troll"

The people who think "mean words" are a reason to ban someone from the game are the reason I mute all every single game. I want to play, I don't want to be part of the community. I don't even know why I'm posting this on the forums except some form of masochistic self hate.

The worst that should happen to someone for "abusing" the chat is to be permanently muted. That solves the problem. Anything else is just pandering to weakling whiners who want to see people they don't like punished by the teacher.

If I could just turn off chat entirely I would. All I need are notifications of in game events and pings.

Except, permanent mutes wouldn't work. If I was violently angry at someone, screaming and spewing hate at them for no good reason, do you think removing my ability to scream would do anything? No - I'd just start throwing punches and kicks.

The same goes for League; they tried doing permanent chat restrictions, and all it did was lead to players ruining the game through trolling or feeding.

It's not about "mean words", it's about the rules and common decency.

If someone does trolling and feeding then you ban them. You whack people on the channel that they're misbehaving in. If they're misbehaving through gameplay, they lose the ability to play the game. If they're misbehaving through communication, you lose the ability to communicate. 

It's absolutely about "mean words" for many many people.

And rules are meaningless if they don't move towards a worthwhile purpose. Following rules and enforcing rules are not virtues on their own. They become virtues when the rules have a tangible benefit. This is why pedantic, over literal people are nearly universally despised.

> If someone does trolling and feeding then you ban them. You whack people on the channel that they're misbehaving in. If they're misbehaving through gameplay, they lose the ability to play the game. If they're misbehaving through communication, you lose the ability to communicate.

Except, that's how you _want_ the rules to work. In reality, the rules work like this;

- Players punished for gameplay related offences (intentional feeding, trolling, etc.) or zero-tolerance chat (hate speech, encouragements of self-harm, etc.) are given a 14-day ban, with the next punishment being a permaban.
- Players punished for chat related offences (harassment, overbearing negativity, verbal abuse, etc.) are given a 10-game chat restriction, followed by a 25-game chat restriction, then 14-day ban, and ultimately a permaban. 
- Players can skip punishment tiers if their behavior is proven to be severe enough to warrant such a skip.

Ultimately, players who go through the tiers of punishment for moderate chat-related offences are ultimately treated as they should be. They're eventually treated much the same as people who go out of their way to ruin games, because that is exactly what they're doing.

And if you go out of your way to ruin the game - whether it's through chat or through trolling - you're going to get kicked out.

Full stop.

---

As for the rest of what you said, I'm not gonna bother with. There's no point in repeating something so clear cut, and I'm not about to drone on in some philosophical debate about "what are rules", because it's pointless. The rules are the rules, Riot set them, we follow them. End of discussion.

Regarding your question about people who get 2x 2 week bans:

Depending on when they got punished, they may have gotten 2 week bans before the punishment system changed. Back in the day, they didn't have the 2 week ban/next punishment = perma system, so you would see people with several 2 week bans.

Additionally, with the new system, if you can get your account back into good standing before your next infraction, then there is a chance that you will get another 2 week ban for a bad infraction rather than a permaban. If you get an infraction while you are still in bad standing, then you will definitely get a permaban.

It sounds like you had a 2 week ban, were still in bad standing, and got punished again, which escalated your punishment to permaban.
